greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider all pairs of primes (p,q) with p+q = 2n, p <= q; a(n) is the sum of all the p's.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} i * c(i) * c(2*n-i), where c = A010051. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 29 2021
example: 2*5 = 10 can be expressed as the sum of two primes in two ways, 3+7 and 5+5, so a(5) = 3+5 = 8.
maple: a:=n-> sum( (i)*( ((pi(i) - pi(i-1)) * (pi(2*n-i) - pi(2*n-i-1))) ), i = 1..n ); seq(a(k),k=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jan 20 2013
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(s=0); forprime(p=1, n, if (isprime(2*n-p), s += p)); s; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 29 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 11 2011
